intro: Hieracium chlorolomum, commonly known as the green-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. It thrives in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Hieracium chlorolomum is often found in sunny locations and is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes.
